title: Canadian man who stole 'belligerent' Churchill portrait sentenced to jail
summary: A Canadian man who stole an iconic portrait of a scowling Winston Churchill has been sentenced to two years in jail, according to local media.

title: Huge explosion rocks chemical plant in China
summary: The blast knocked out windows of a storage facility more than three kilometres from the site, with more than 200 fire fighters and officials sent to the scene.

title: Fremantle skipper Alex Pearce's three-match ban overturned at AFL tribunal
summary: Fremantle successfully appealed the suspension for rough conduct during Saturday's match against Port Adelaide.

title: NSW MP Gareth Ward used groin to massage 18-year-old man, trial hears
summary: A court has heard details of two sexual assaults allegedly perpetrated by former NSW cabinet minister Gareth Ward, during the opening remarks of his sexual assault trial.

title: Pilot involved in fatal Ball Bay crash arrested after walking out of court
summary: A north Queensland pilot involved in a fatal joy-ride near Mackay in 2021 was arrested and brought back into court after walking out of his committal hearing without bail.

title: NT judge fines group of illegal foreign fishers more than $80,000
summary: A Northern Territory judge said he needed to "send a message" to illegal fishers, while fining 18 Indonesian nationals more than $80,000 for fishing in Australian waters.

title: Sherpa scales Mount Everest for 31st time, beating non-Sherpa record by 12 climbs
summary: Kami Rita, 55, first climbed Everest in 1994 and has done so almost every year since.

title: Australian Holocaust survivor Yvonne Engelman dies aged 98
summary: Remembering the life of Yvonne Engelman, who survived the horrors of the Nazi concentration camp Auschwitz.

title: Hospitals not always following sepsis protocol after toddler's death, inquest told
summary: An inquest into the death of Pippa Mae White, who died of sepsis and pneumonia, hears from a health executive who claims hospitals are still not regularly using a sepsis diagnostic guide.

title: Court bid to stop 'Extinction Rebellion on wheels' blocking bridge
summary: Police will appear at the Brisbane Magistrates Court on Thursday to argue that the march, which would block all six traffic lanes, should not go ahead.

title: Rock art expert accuses WA government of rock art 'propaganda'
summary: One of the world's leading rock art specialists accuses the WA government of burying evidence that shows current pollution levels in the state's north has left ancient petroglyphs resembling "Swiss cheese".

title: Handmaid's Tale finale: Does June Osborne's death stare finally deliver on promise to Gilead?
summary:
Beleaguered fans have watched June suffer through six seasons over eight years in a bid to free herself and save her daughter. Now the season finale offers them hope of some relief — but does it deliver?
(Warning: spoilers ahead.)

title: After changing its website, Telstra’s now digging in on mobile coverage
summary: Telstra CEO Vicki Brady defends claim the telco provides 3 million square kilometres of coverage without using an external antenna.

title: Energy giant gets green light for controversial coal exploration in NSW
summary: Although it has exhausted all legal appeals to overturn rejections of its coal mine plans, South Korean company KEPCO will be allowed to explore for coal in Bylong until 2027.

title: Norwegian princess moving to Australia for university
summary: Norwegian Princess Ingrid Alexandra will be moving to New South Wales for a Bachelor of Arts degree at the University of Sydney.

title: Australian-first ice hockey rink takes over AIS basketball court
summary: The Australian Institute of Sport transforms a basketball court into an ice rink for the Canberra Brave. The rink is the first in the league to have full bowl seating.

title: 'Small business fetishism' pushing up home building costs
summary: What if there was a way to build 12 per cent more homes a year with no extra construction workers? Economists say there might be.

title: NSW chief justice takes rare step to shed light on soaring remand numbers
summary: In a rare public statement, Chief Justice Andrew Bell says the denial of bail leaves innocent people at risk of being kept behind bars for "a considerable period of time".

title: Sidelined wheelchair basketballers fight to reclaim Paralympics entry
summary: After missing out on qualification for the Paris Paralympics, women's wheelchair basketball has strengthened its domestic competition ahead of Brisbane 2032.

title: Man dies in custody after altercation with Alice Springs security guard
summary: Police say the death of an Aboriginal man who was restrained by two officers in Alice Springs will be investigated as a death in custody.

title: China now 'more debt collector than banker' to developing world
summary: New research shows that China has emerged as the world's largest debtor for developing nations, which are due to pay back at least $54 billion to Beijing this year.

title: NSW premier rues loss of 'golden opportunity' after no vote to Rosehill sale
summary: On Tuesday, about 11,000 members voted on the fate of the racecourse, bringing a 17-month-long saga to end. The no vote was carried by 56.1 per cent of the ballots.

title: US company linked to Trump administration in talks over Darwin Port
summary: An American investment firm linked to US President Donald Trump's administration has shown interest in the Port of Darwin, which is currently leased by a Chinese-owned company.

title: Senior doctor blows whistle and NSW Health launches review into claims about major hospital
summary: A surgeon is speaking out after hospital management re-categorised the urgency of some cancer surgeries from highest to lowest without consulting him.

title: Warning opposition plan to scrap stamp duty on first homes could push prices up
summary: The Victorian opposition has used its budget reply to showcase a pledge to scrap stamp duty for first home buyers on properties up to $1 million if it wins government next year.
